channel.title: Need help choosing a laptop
channel.description:
I'm going to college to study 'applied informatics' (application development more specific). As the name suggests, it's mainly about programming (java) but also some other aspects like networkmanagement etc.
I'm not sure at all what laptop I should buy, so I hope anyone could give me some feedback?
Minimum specs: • Processor: min. Intel Core 2 (of equivalent) • Memory RAM: min. 4 Gigabyte • Hard drive: min. 160 Gigabyte • Screen size: 15,4 of 15,6 inch (recommended) • Wireless network adapter • CD/DVD Reader/Writer • VGA connection • Operating system: you can choose (Windows, Linux or Mac) [i](I don't want Mac, I think I'd go for a Windows also running Linux?)[/i] Warning: the laptop must be able to run Linux!

item.title: Need help choosing a laptop
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

most likely you would have to install the linux your own self.

This looks like it fits your needs fairly well

http://www.bestbuy.com/site/Toshiba+-+Satellite+15.6%26%2334%3B+Laptop+-+4GB+Memory+-+320GB+Hard+Drive+-+Satin+Black/1306016825.p?id=mp1306016825&skuId=1306016825

says it doesn’t have a hdmi port so most likely it is vga

newegg option:

newegg.com

Lenovo Laptop G505 (59371430) AMD E1-Series E1-2100 (1.00 GHz) 4...

Buy Lenovo Laptop G505 (59371430) AMD E1-Series E1-2100 (1.00 GHz) 4 GB Memory 320 GB HDD AMD Radeon HD 8210 15.6" Windows 8 with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Once you know, you Newegg!

^ max ram supported is 8gb so you can always upgrade later. says it has vga

tigerdirect option:

http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=7708074&CatId=4935

^ looks like a nice deal really…500gb hdd/media reader/decent integrated vid card

the one thing I would try to stay away from are:

  1. acers - horrible stock fans/are placed inconveniently so overheat Easily
  2. hp - overpriced

Read full topic

item.title: Need help choosing a laptop
item.dc:creator: @Kattoor Snow_
item.description:
@Kattoor wrote:

I’m going to college to study ‘applied informatics’ (application development more specific).
As the name suggests, it’s mainly about programming (java) but also some other aspects like networkmanagement etc.

I’m not sure at all what laptop I should buy, so I hope anyone could give me some feedback?

Minimum specs:
• Processor: min. Intel Core 2
(of equivalent)
• Memory RAM: min. 4 Gigabyte
• Hard drive: min. 160 Gigabyte
• Screen size: 15,4 of 15,6 inch
(recommended)
• Wireless network adapter
• CD/DVD Reader/Writer
• VGA connection
• Operating system: you can choose (Windows,
Linux or Mac) (I don’t want Mac, I think I’d go for a Windows also running Linux?)
Warning: the laptop must be able to run Linux!

Read full topic
